item.title: Report X-2024071227
item.description:
Report X-2024071227

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-23T15:14:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered by an OPS Supervisor opening a trailer. It was already damaged. The OPS Supervisor alerted the on duty OPS Admin. OPS Admin safley placed the package in a lined hazmat bin and transported it to the locked hazmat cage for further processing. Any spill clean up was done by the same OPS admin and the area was safe and clean to work in again.

item.title: Report I-2024050016
item.description:
Report I-2024050016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-20T00:36:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Savages Services
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While conducting arrival inspection on an Arkema railcar (Telx73272) and noticed some product on the side of the railcar. While on top of the car he found product on the side of the housing and immediately notified the Ops Manager. Emergency response contractor, Hepaco, was dispatched to evaluate car issue. During their assessment, they discovered the flange gasket had failed and needed to be replaced.

item.title: Report I-2024060045
item.description:
Report I-2024060045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: CHAPIN
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: E.J. Pope & Son Inc. dba Pope Transport
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. During delivery, the vent line failed, which resulted in the release of approximately 50 gallons of gasoline to the asphalt parking lot and nearby storm drain. The Local Fire Department responded to assess and applied absorbent material to contain the release. First Call Environmental was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, First Call Environmental applied additional absorbent material, which was worked in and recovered. First Call Environmental utilized a drum vacuum to recover the free product from the storm drain catch basin, and confirmed product was contained to catch basin and did not migrate through the sewer system. Two 55-gallon drums of spent absorbent material were generated during the cleanup. There was no impact to soils or threat to state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
